{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3550367,"name":"John Slagel","username":"Novicaine","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ac8455/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-07T14:48:50.750Z","cooked":"

Just curious, has anyone tried these in FRC?

image758×664 47.7 KB

These are devices called “Loss of Power Brakes”, which are commonly found on electric wheelchair/scooter/Jazzy motors. Basically they are locked up unless you apply 24V and then the electric magnet releases the brake and allow it to spin. So you could power it while you run the winch, then when power is removed, it would hold

Example Item for sale on Alibaba

According to these rules, it seems legal:

frctools.com

Rule R501

R501      *Allowable motors. The only motors and actuators permitted include the following (in any quantity):

frctools.com

Rule R614

R614      *No high voltage allowed. Any active electrical item that is not an actuator (specified in R501) or core control system item (specified in R710) is considered a CUSTOM CIRCUIT. CUSTOM CIRCUITS shall not produce...
